attributes.action: Ensure mps only get a payrise when the people (ie their employers) say
attributes.additional_details:
According to news sources 
Mps had 
1.8 per cent boost to MPs’ pay last year, 
1.4 per cent in 2017, 
1.3 per cent in 2016 
And a huge jump  from £67,000 to £74,000 in July 2015.

As well as the huge list of expenses I think this is unacceptable and needs to be stopped!  I think as their employers the public should be allowed to decide if they get a rise or not! It’s our public money they are spending we should decide IF they have done enough to earn a rise!
attributes.background: This country has been under austerity measures for years. Nurses and teachers have had little to no pay increases for around ten years. Disabled people, unemployed and pensioners have endured hardships and more people are using food banks yet mps have had a payrise consistently!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' pay and expenses. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
